titleStmt.title: Auden Musulin Papers: A Digital Edition of W. H. Auden´s Letters to Stella Musulin (FWF P 33754)
Autograph Notes [?] on Stella Musulin "Auden in Kirchstetten" and "In Retrospect" [?]

publicationStmt.publisher: Austrian Centre for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

seriesStmt.p: Machine-Readable Transcriptions of the Auden Musulin Papers

div.p:
P. 7 Line 8 "Eliot hardly deserved it`:" Does this mean that you dont
think Eliot was worth translating? Or that Auden didnt?
(see p. 16-17)

P. 2 Line 7 Would 'Chester'. Would it be helpful at this
✓ first mention of him to add the surname , i.e.
'Chester Kallman'. ?

P1. Line 6 from bottom: "if his life as a". Should this be "if his
life as one" or "if his life as a whole" ?

p. 3 Para 2 Money pinched from Chesters jacket at party.
Incident already referred to in bottom para p.13
of "Auden in Kirchstetten ". Since this para is
in brackets perhaps this is an indication that
you intended to omit it?

Check with xx
what is in his M.S.

p3 Line 4 from bottom " at Hinterholz 6" ?? Desirable to add
`Kirchstetten' for sake of clarity ?

p. 16 . Bottom Last sentence over top P.17✓
xxx of "he whose name we never mention' at
funeral. ?Repetition of mention of this on
p.14 top para, of "Auden in Kirchstetten".
